Service.Name: OGC:WMS
Service.Title: Canadian Geographical Names Web Map Service
Service.Abstract: Canadian Geographical Names Service (CGNS) provides an online OpenGIS Consortium (OGC) compliant web mapping service interface and is compatible with the CGDI. The CGNS is a 3 tiered framework of data, application, and information services. The CGNS WMS allows for custom cartographic styling through the OGC Styled Layer Descriptor (SLD) Specification. Its purpose is to store names that have been approved by the Geographical Names Board of Canada (GNBC) and to make these authoritative records available for government and public use. Le Service de cartes Web (SCW) de Service canadien de toponymie est un service Internet qui donne aux concepteurs d'outils cartographiques OGC, un accès aux toponymes et leurs attributs. Grace à ce service, les développeurs peuvent accéder à nos données de base les plus récentes. Le sous-ensemble des données du SCT qui sera offert pour la visualisation est celui des toponymes officiellement approuvés.

Attribution.Title: Canadian Geographical Names Service Web Feature Service
Canadian Geographical Names Service Web Feature Service

Layer.Name: GEONAMES:cgns
Layer.Title: Canadian Geographical Names
Layer.Abstract: The Canadian Geographical Names Data Base (CGNDB) is the authoritative data bank of Canada's geographical names, maintained by the Geographical Names Section, Centre for Topographic Information, Geomatics Canada, Natural Resources Canada. Its purpose is to store geographical names that have been approved by the Geographical Names Board of Canada (GNBC) and to make these authoritative records available for government and public use. The subset of the CGNDB data which will be served up consists of current officially approved names, and will be referred to as the Canadian Geographical Names Service data set. The purpose of the CGNS is to provide a national repository for officially approved Canadian geographical names [i.e., geographical names that have been recognized by the Geographical Names Board of Canada (GNBC)]. La Base de donnies toponymiques du Canada (BDTC) est la banque de donnies regroupant les toponymes canadiens girie par la Section de toponymie du Centre d'information topographique de Ressources naturelles Canada. On y emmagasine les toponymes et leurs attributs qui ont iti approuvis par la Commission de toponymie du Canada (CTC) afin que ces fichiers faisant autoriti puissent jtre consultis par le personnel du gouvernement et le public. Le sous-ensemble des donnies de la BDTC qui sera offert pour la visualisation est celui des toponymes officiellement approuvis et sera disigni par l'expression jeu de donnies sur les Toponymes canadiens niveau 1 (TC1). C'est igalement le jeu de donnies qui est offert par le Service canadien de toponymie (SCT).

Layer.Name: graticule
Layer.Title: Lat/Lon Graticule
Layer.Abstract: Produces graticule lines every 10 degrees of latitude and longitude. If the STYLE for this layer is set to a number, the graticule lines will be spaced that many degrees apart. A STYLE of the form "number:number" is also accepted, specifying the longitudinal and latitudinal spacing separately.

Layer.Name: crosshairs
Layer.Title: Crosshairs
Layer.Abstract: Displays a set of crosshairs to indicate the center of the image
